definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(standing) very straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright/well-ironed/trim
to endure with all one's will/to hold out/rigid/stiff
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
(lit.) to lie stiff like a corpse/(coll.) to sleep

sentences.english: Blair: Well, lucky for you, your friend is someone I actually care about.
sentences.chinese: 算你走运，你的那位朋友碰巧是我挺在乎的一个人。

sentences.english: Have Chesapeake and other natural-gas producers survived the worst of the crisis?
sentences.chinese: 切萨皮克以及其他的天然气公司真的挺过来了吗？

sentences.english: It was nerve-wracking somehow this year. But I still came through.
sentences.chinese: 今年很多时候有些紧张刺激，但我都挺过来了。

sentences.english: I think you should just admit that you're a big softy .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我觉得你得承认自己挺多愁善感。

sentences.english: We are doing fine, meeting the customers' needs.
sentences.chinese: 挺好的，满脚了客户的需求。

sentences.english: In other places it seems he enjoyed the slight tremble and wander of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 而在其他地方，他似乎挺满意手上轻微的颤抖和晃动。

sentences.english: He was happy, however, that he was not in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他还是挺开心的，因为他不用呆在牢房里。

sentences.english: I would also love to hear your ways of fighting weight.
sentences.chinese: 我也喜欢听挺你的战斗历程。

sentences.english: It is risky to drive that old car around.
sentences.chinese: 开着那台老爷车四处跑还挺危险的。

sentences.english: Is one thing she liked the strike, and spare, like a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 就是有一点她挺喜欢罢课，和饶老师一样。

sentences.english: He felt rather sad at that piece of music.
sentences.chinese: 听到那首曲子时，她感到挺伤心的。
